context_bundle.summary: Encryption for data protection at rest and in transit: At rest: AES-256 (files, databases, backups), disk encryption (BitLocker, LUKS). In transit: TLS 1.2+ (HTTPS, secure APIs), SSH for remote access. Asymmetric: RSA/ECC for key exchange. Symmetric: AES for data encryption. Tools: OpenSSL, Let's Encrypt (free TLS certs), Azure/AWS encryption services. Patterns: encrypt sensitive fields (DB columns), use HTTPS for all APIs, certificate management (auto-renewal).

onboarding.quick_start: Encryption: At rest: AES-256 for files/DB, BitLocker (Windows disk), dm-crypt/LUKS (Linux). In transit: TLS 1.2+ (HTTPS), SSH for servers. PowerShell: ConvertTo-SecureString, ConvertFrom-SecureString. OpenSSL: openssl enc -aes-256-cbc -in file -out file.enc. Let's Encrypt: certbot --nginx for free TLS certs. DB column encryption: ENCRYPT(field, key). API: enforce HTTPS, redirect HTTP -> HTTPS. Certificate management: auto-renew with Let's Encrypt/ACME. Asymmetric (RSA): key exchange. Symmetric (AES): data encryption (faster). Use for: passwords, PII, API traffic, backups.
common_patterns: AES-256 encryption: openssl enc -aes-256-cbc -salt -in file.txt -out file.enc
DB column encryption: CREATE TABLE users (password VARBINARY(256)), INSERT ENCRYPT('pass', key)
API: enforce HTTPS, app.use(requireHTTPS), redirect HTTP -> HTTPS
SSH: ssh user@server -i private_key.pem, key-based auth
Asymmetric (RSA/ECC): openssl genrsa -out private.key 4096, public/private key pairs
